text.paragraph: Public Health Reporting Communication: one or more conditions are reportable, or may be reportable, to public health.

act.text: Public Health Reporting Communication: one or more conditions are reportable, or may be reportable, to public health.

code.displayName: Initial case report processing information Document

text.paragraph: Your organization electronically submitted an initial case report to determine if reporting to public health is needed for a patient.

"Disease caused by severe acute respitory syndrome cornavirus 2" is reportable to "Senate District Health Department". The initial case report was sent to "Senate District Health Department". Additional information may be required for this report.

paragraph.content: "Disease caused by severe acute respitory syndrome cornavirus 2" for "Senate District Health Department"

text.paragraph: Reporting is required immediately. Reporting to this Public Health Agency is based on "Both patient home address and provider facility address"

paragraph.content: > Senate District Health Department Epidemiology Web Page (Information only)

act.text: Your organization electronically submitted an initial case report to determine if reporting to public health is needed for a patient.

code.originalText: This electronic case report serves as a TEST REPORT. Reporting for 2019 nCov is required immediately. While an electronic case report was sent on to Senate District Department of Health, because the system is not in full production at this date, this report does NOT currently satisfy your reporting requirements. Please continue to report 2019 nCov using your normal methods. Click here to get information on how to report to the Senate District Department of Health!
For more information or if you have any questions, please contact the Senate District Department of Health at 1-866-692-3641

observation.value: Influenza caused by novel, highly pathogenic avian influenza A virus (H5N1) is immediately reportable in all jurisdictions
Clinical findings: fever with respiratory symptoms and positive laboratory test for H5N1 influenza

code.originalText: H5N1 Avian Influenza is a highly pathogenic strain requiring immediate notification. Please report using established procedures for immediate reportable conditions.

code.originalText: This electronic case report serves as a TEST REPORT. Reporting for H5N1 Avian Influenza is required immediately. While an electronic case report was sent on to Senate District Department of Health, because the system is not in full production at this date, this report does NOT currently satisfy your reporting requirements. Please continue to report H5N1 Avian Influenza using your normal methods. Click here to get information on how to report to the Senate District Department of Health!
For more information or if you have any questions, please contact the Senate District Department of Health Avian Influenza Response Team at 1-866-692-3642

Detection of H5N1 influenza virus RNA in a clinical specimen by any method
Patient with travel to areas with known H5N1 outbreaks in domestic or wild birds within 10 days of symptom onset

code.originalText: Senate District Health Department Avian Influenza Program

H5N1 is a highly pathogenic strain with significant mortality risk. Implement airborne and contact precautions immediately. Patient should be placed in negative pressure isolation. Healthcare workers should use N95 respirators or higher level protection, eye protection, gowns and gloves. Notify infection control immediately.
